timeline.bodyText: I wonder if this is going to work well w.r.t. caching. So far we relied on the version number to change I think.
timeline.author: vladak

replies.bodyText:
The final code looks like this so version is still there :)
<script type="text/javascript" src="/opengrok_web_war/webjars/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js" data-priority="10"</script>
replies.author: ahornace

replies.bodyText: I'll probably need to modify ExpiresOneDayFilter to include /webjars.
replies.author: ahornace

replies.bodyText: Then it would be ok I guess.
replies.author: tulinkry

timeline.bodyText: I didn't know + was better than a builder
timeline.author: tulinkry

replies.bodyText: String concatenation uses StringBuilder in the backend so there is no performance gain but it's shorter this way.
replies.author: ahornace

replies.bodyText: In this case the builder approach was slightly more readable for me however that's probably just a matter of taste.
replies.author: vladak

replies.bodyText: This was suggested by IDEA and I thought removing the clutter is better but I can revert it back :)
replies.author: ahornace

timeline.message: Move Scripts and dependent classes to web module
